alert.note: Alert for Custer; Dewey; Ellis; Roger Mills (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 07 at 5:39AM CDT until July 07 at 9:00AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of northwest and western Oklahoma, including the following counties, in northwest Oklahoma, Dewey, Ellis, Major and Woodward. In western Oklahoma, Custer and Roger Mills. * WHEN...Until 845 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 539 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Taloga, Thomas, Seiling, Leedey, Camargo, Oakwood, Putnam, Angora, Moorewood, Cestos, Chester, Roll, Orion, Crawford, Fay, northwestern Canton Lake, Durham and Hucmac. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
